intro: Memecylon lancifolium, commonly known as the lancifoliate memecylon, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Asia, particularly India and Southeast Asia. The plant is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves that are often glossy and dark green. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. Memecylon lancifolium is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
